Greetings {1_Name}, is there something you need?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_EconomyWise}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{3_HappinessWise}

Greetings {1_Name}.[NEWLINE]Here are the reports of our vassals. We can indirectly influence how they choose their civics by taxing them, but we should beware of the likelihood for them to revolt if that is even such a thing.

Greetings {1_Name}.[NEWLINE]We have an accurate information due to their willingness to share their government functions with us. We can increase our friendliness with them by having the same type of civics as them, but we should be wary whenever our own infrastructure can handle it.

Greetings {1_Name}.[NEWLINE]Our Embassy at their [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital can make a somewhat-accurate report in what their government looks like. We could be more accurate if we had a [ICON_DIPLOMAT] Diplomat stationed or signed a [ICON_FLOWER] Declaration of Friendship with them.

It seems we have little information on their political form of governing. Spies do very little in securing any accurate retainable information. Perhaps, we can establish an embassy in their [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital? We can probably assume what their civics are like if we share our similar taste in civic form.. but other than that. We're going have to guess a lot on things.
Oh my. Are you hiding a banana in your pant or are you just glad to see me?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You shouldn't be seeing this. Report this to the developer with what civilization you are seeing at.
[ICON_GOLD][ICON_GOLD][ICON_GOLD]
Total (-{1_CivicKeep}[ICON_GOLD])
Civics of Other Civilizations
Select to View
Civic Overview
{1_CivicName} (-{2_CivicKeep}[ICON_GOLD])
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hereditary Rule[ENDCOLOR] can mitigate the production cost of wonders and grants happiness through garrisons.
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Representation[ENDCOLOR] works well in urban cities as the specialization can help progress the nation much quicker!
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Totalitarianism[ENDCOLOR] might be necessary to ensure order and constant obedience from the local populace.
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]National Suffrage[ENDCOLOR] may be useful in cities with many Great People Improvements and villages.
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Patronage[ENDCOLOR] synergizes well in obtaining city-state alliances.
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Codified Law[ENDCOLOR] can help with border growth significantly in the early game.
Tip: Stay hydrated!
Tip: In war, a fool's first lesson is his last.
Tip: You may want to review some of the civics best suited to you as you advance through the eras.
Tip: The default civics will not cause a revolution in your cities, try it!
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Feudalism[ENDCOLOR] may be effective when in need of experienced units and leadership.
Tip: Civics with [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]High Upkeep[ENDCOLOR] will increase your base building maintenance from 16%-20%!
Tip: Civics with [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Medium Upkeep[ENDCOLOR] will increase your base building maintenance from 11%-15%!
Tip: Civics with [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Low Upkeep[ENDCOLOR] will increase your base building maintenance from 5%-10%!
Tip: Civics with [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]No Upkeep[ENDCOLOR] won't increase your building maintenance at all. Now that's efficiency!
Tip: Civic and Reform is always evolving, but it can evolve faster with your help. Post reports and suggestions!
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Bureaucracy[ENDCOLOR] may be inefficient and expanding, but it is expanding to meet the need of the bureaucracy!
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nationhood[ENDCOLOR] is perfect for civilizations who prefer espionage.
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Free Speech[ENDCOLOR] is ultimately the best for protecting against the propaganda of the enemies!
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Slavery[ENDCOLOR] may be considered immoral, but production is production.
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Manorialism[ENDCOLOR] may be for those who prefer more out of the farms and growing!
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Celebrity Worship[ENDCOLOR] may be powerful to establish a strong cultural defense!
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Commercialism[ENDCOLOR] can help civilizations who prefer trading with themselves.
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Environmentalism[ENDCOLOR] can aid in a cultural victory and help improve the unclaimed wilderness.
Tip: Salt may be the preferred human satisfaction, but there are more to things in life than salt.
Tip: If you're an avid crusader, [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Theocracy[ENDCOLOR] may be perfect for you.
Tip: Be wary of gold maintenance, maximize your merchants and you can have efficiency in maintaining your infrastructure!
Tip: Are your cities heavily religious and devoted? An [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Organized Faith[ENDCOLOR] can be of great use!
Tip: Switching to civics with higher upkeep tend to have less chances of revolution!
Tip: People tend to be a little more unhappy due to different government types being more acceptable. Be diverse in your civic selection!
Tip: Sharing civics with higher upkeeps tend to have a higher diplomatic likening.
Tip: Never starve your people. If you can't stop the insane growth, you can ask the governor to avoid growth for you.
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]State Property[ENDCOLOR] works well to defund those corporations to produce food and hammers for the people!
Tip: Having an open-mind to [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Free Religion[ENDCOLOR] somehow leads to philosophical thoughts.
Tip: Sometime you can predict what other leaders are going for based on what civics they are pursuing.
Tip: When building roads, keep in mind about military manueverment as well.
Tip: It's okay if foreign leaders give you less compensation than expected. You'll be compensated in the relationship instead.
Tip: Take control of your cities more if you have to. The city governors can never be trusted with efficiency.
Tip: The pen is mightier than the sword. Use diplomacy when force does not warrant the situation.
Tip: If you chase two rabbits, you will lose them both.
Tip: The wisest men follow their own direction.
Tip: One doesn't discover new lands without losing sight of the shore.
Tip: There is no wealth like knowledge, no poverty like ignorance.
Tip: The whole is more than the sum of its parts.
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Confederation[ENDCOLOR] helps grant your cities greater economic independence at a cost of happiness issues.
Tip: For nations who rely on golden ages, [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Constutionalism[ENDCOLOR] can truly turn a nation great.
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Unionism[ENDCOLOR] is perhaps powerful for developing cities through guilds.
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Decentralization[ENDCOLOR] can be preferred if you have a small need for infrastructure.
Tip: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ancestor Veneration[ENDCOLOR] may be powerful earlier when sources of faith are limited.
Tip: It doesn't matter what your political beliefs are. You choose what is the best for your people.
